CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 20, 1953, pg. 14 reads: "Home Service Fair Prize-Winners, Demonstrator - Prize-winners at the four sessions of the Courier's 1953 Home Service Fair were so numerous that it would be impossible for the Courier to print pictures of all of them. However, here are pictures of just a few who won prizes...In the far right picture, more prize-winners are shown with their prizes.  Left to right: Mrs. Ethel Hall, who won a lighter; Mrs. Susie Fluker, who won an electric iron and an Ella Rene Beauty School scholarship; Howard Gregg, who won a watch; Mrs. Annabelle Allen, who won a Mixmaster, and Mrs. Jessie Turnipseed, who won a Pepsi-Cola Cooler. - All Photos by Harris
TitMainTitle: Group of prize winners, from left: Ethel Hall, Susie Fluker, Howard Gregg, Annabelle Allen, and Jessie Turnipseed, standing in front of stage with Mattie Handy in background, Jessie Vann, and Daisy Lampkin, during the 1953 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair, Ammon Center
